trans-unit.source: Represents the SMTP section in the <xref uid="langword_csharp_System.Net" name="System.Net" href=""></xref> configuration file.
This class provides programmatic access to information that can be stored in configuration files that are used by classes that support SMTP in the <xref:System.Net.Mail> namespace.
Initializes a new instance of the <xref href="System.Net.Configuration.SmtpSection"></xref> class.
Gets or sets the delivery format to use for sending outgoing e-mail using the Simple Mail Transport Protocol (SMTP).
Returns <xref href="System.Net.Mail.SmtpDeliveryFormat"></xref>.
The delivery format to use for sending outgoing e-mail using SMTP.
Gets or sets the Simple Mail Transport Protocol (SMTP) delivery method.
The default delivery method is <xref href="System.Net.Mail.SmtpDeliveryMethod"></xref>.
Valid values for this property are <xref:System.Net.Mail.SmtpDeliveryMethod>, <xref:System.Net.Mail.SmtpDeliveryMethod>, and <xref:System.Net.Mail.SmtpDeliveryMethod>.
These values have configurable sub-items and have a corresponding section in the `System.Net` configuration file.
All the sections are camel-cased, to allow the users to match the delivery method with their corresponding section names.
A string that represents the SMTP delivery method.
Gets or sets the default value that indicates who the email message is from.
A string that represents the default value indicating who a mail message is from.
Gets the configuration element that controls the network settings used by the Simple Mail Transport Protocol (SMTP).
file.<xref href="System.Net.Configuration.SmtpNetworkElement"></xref>.
A <xref href="System.Net.Configuration.SmtpNetworkElement"></xref> object.
The configuration element that controls the network settings used by SMTP.
To be added.
Gets the pickup directory that will be used by the SMPT client.
Indicates that directory specified by <xref:System.Net.Mail.SmtpClient.PickupDirectoryLocation%2A> will be used as the SMTP pickup directory.
If the SMTP client is unable to write to the pickup directory location an I/O exception is thrown by <xref:System.Net.Mail.SmtpClient.Send%2A>.
The directory will not be created if it does not exist.
The credentials of the currently running thread or process will be used to access the directory.
A <xref href="System.Net.Configuration.SmtpSpecifiedPickupDirectoryElement"></xref> object that specifies the pickup directory folder.
